author: Special Correspondent
text:
Union Human Resource Development Minister Smriti Irani on Wednesday accused the Trinamool Congress of indulging in vote bank politics over the suicide of a Dalit student in Hyderabad while ignoring atrocities committed against Dalits in West Bengal.

Addressing a party gathering at Durgapur in the State’s Bardhaman district, Ms. Irani said that while a TMC leader (Derek O’ Brien) went to Hyderabad after the suicide of a Dalit student, no one visited Nadia where three Dalits were killed in May 2015.

The BJP leader accused the TMC government of failing to ensure law and order and said that it had not taken action after atrocities against women in the State.

“I ask the Mamata Banerjee government how many more girls will they sacrifice and how much more blood will be shed by the party that had promised to bring change [parivartan],” she said.

Ms. Irani also alleged that last year “the Trinamool government had not allowed immersion of idols during Durga Puja.” The State government had suspended immersion on October 23 and 24 because it coincided with Muharram. Immersion was allowed before and after the two-day window.

The Minister also raised the issue of violence at Malda.
title: ‘Trinamool indulging in vote-bank politics’
